means: strapdown inertial guidance and navigation (system) 捷联式惯性制导与导航（系统）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词(动词)均有"叹息声，叹息"之意。
means: groan ： 侧重指因受到难忍受的精神负担或强烈的痛苦等而发出沉重的呻吟，也指显示强烈不满的叹息声。
moan语气比groan强，多指拉长的或连续的悲叹(声)或呻吟(声)。
sigh ： 多指无意识地发出表示沮丧、悲痛、悔恨或厌倦等情绪的深沉叹息。
sob ： 指抽噎声或呜咽声，或边说边哭。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"标志，象征，符号"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: symbol, badge, sign, signal, mark, token, attribute, emblem
means: symbol ： 指作象征或表达某种深邃意蕴的特殊事物。
badge ： 一般指金属证章或写有姓名的带状标志物。
sign ： 普通用词，指人们公认事物的记号，也可指某种情况的征兆。
signal ： 指为某一目的而有意发出的信号。
mark ： 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指方便于辨认而有意做的标记，又可指自然形成的标记或有别于他事物的特征。
token ： 语气庄重，指礼品、纪念物等作为表示友谊、爱情等的象征或标志。
attribute ： 指人或物及其地位、属性的象征。
emblem ： 指选定象征一个国家、民族或家庭等的图案或实物。

word_mean: 朕兆：提示某事物的存在
体征：疾病的客观证据，例如医生检查时发现与病人主观感觉(症状)相反的证据

sentence.Network_en: The priest made the sign of the cross over him.
sentence.Network_cn: 神父在他上方画了个十字。

sentence.Network_en: Her son used sign language to tell her what happened.
sentence.Network_cn: 她儿子用手语告诉她发生了什么事。

sentence.Network_en: Democratic leaders have challenged the president to sign the bill.
sentence.Network_cn: 民主党领袖对总统签署这项法案提出了质疑。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 符号学的核心是符号（sign），根据Peirce的定义，“符号…(以表现体的形式出现) 就是相对某人而言在某个方面和从某种能力上代表 …
老鬼钓鱼论坛 - Powered by Discuz! ... 帮助 Help 签名 Sign 导读 Guide.
志字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 做记号〖 mark〗 标记;记号〖 sign;mark〗 志气 zhìq&#236.
记号学把一对能指和所指合称为一个记号（sign），并明定记号是一个实体。他们认为 Information 应视同记号。

list.abs: 数学专业英语词汇_数学吧_百度贴吧 ... multiplication ring 乘环 multiplication sign 乘号 multiplication table 九九表.
PERCENTILE函数 - Sean的日志 - 网易博客 ... Division 除法 Division sign 除号 Divisor 因子，除数.
要登出（sign out）可以留意右上角。那边应该有连结可以登出的。
菲艾点评网，非爱帮助你 ... 添加 add 注册 sign up 登录 login.
啦啦队运动名词术语（中英对照） ... ★报到( registration) ★报名( sign up) ★出场顺序( sequence).

jx.jx_en_mean: a Christian sign made in blessing or prayer by tracing a cross from the forehead to the chest and to each shoulder, or in the air
something judged to exemplify or indicate the nature or quality of a particular period, typically something unwelcome or unpleasant
jx.jx_cn_mean: 时代的标志（尤指不受欢迎或讨厌的事物）

lj.lj_ly: the theft was a sign of the times.
lj.lj_ls: 偷窃是这个时代的标志。

phrase.cizu_name: signed, sealed, and delivered (或 signed and sealed

jx.jx_en_mean: formally and officially agreed and in effect
officially relinquish rights or property by signing a deed
jx.jx_cn_mean: （在契约上）签字放弃（权利，财产）

lj.lj_ly: I have no intention of signing away my inheritance.
lj.lj_ls: 我无意签字放弃继承权。

jx.jx_en_mean: sign a receipt to confirm that one has received (something delivered or handed over)
record someone's arrival in a register
record that someone is entitled to miss work, typically because of illness
jx.jx_cn_mean: 登记某人（尤指因病）不宜工作

jx.jx_en_mean: (US informal)assent or give one's approval to

lj.lj_ly: it was hard to get celebrities to sign off on those issues.
lj.lj_ls: 很难得到名流对这些问题的认同。

jx.jx_en_mean: authorize someone's release or record their departure by signing a register
jx.jx_cn_mean: 签字放行；登记某人的离开

jx.jx_en_mean: sign to indicate that one has borrowed or hired something
To record the arrival of (another or oneself) by signing a register.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 签到：通过在签名记录（另一个人或者是自己的）到达

jx.jx_en_mean: To announce the end of a communication; conclude.
To stop transmission after identifying the broadcasting station.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在说完广播电台台名之后停止播送

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To express approval formally or conclusively
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 正式同意：正式或结论性地表示同意

lj.lj_ly: got the Congress to sign off on the tax proposal.
lj.lj_ls: 使国会正式同意这项税务提案

means.word_mean: 示意
签署
符号;记号
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French signe (noun), signer (verb), from Latin signum 'mark, token'

encyclopedia.content: 《SIGN》，SBS新水木剧，韩国首部以验尸官为题材的电视剧，以韩国国立科学搜查研究所为舞台，述说在国立科学搜查研究所所发生的法医们的苦痛和生活，还有围绕在他们当中的疑问事件的医学搜查物，破解各种疑案的过程，案件背后隐藏的真相以及组织内部的明争暗斗的故事，朴信阳在剧中将扮演一名天才法医学者，和新来的法医学医生金雅中上演一段浪漫的爱情故事。

entry.def: A sign is a mark or shape that always has a particular meaning, for example in mathematics or music.

example.ex: Equations are generally written with a two-bar equals sign.
example.tran: 等式通常用两道横的等号来表示。

entry.def: A sign is a movement of your arms, hands, or head which is intended to have a particular meaning.

example.ex: They gave Lavalle the thumbs-up sign...
example.tran: 他们对拉瓦列竖起了大拇指。

example.ex: The priest made the sign of the cross over him.
example.tran: 神父在他上方画了个十字。

entry.tran: 打手势语;为(节目或表演)配手语
entry.def: If you sign, you communicate with someone using sign language. If a programme or performance is signed, someone uses sign language so that deaf people can understand it.

example.ex: All programmes will be either 'signed' or subtitled...
example.tran: 所有节目要么要配手语要么要打字幕。

entry.tran: 招牌;标牌;指示牌;告示牌;标志
entry.def: A sign is a piece of wood, metal, or plastic with words or pictures on it. Signs give you information about something, or give you a warning or an instruction.

example.ex: ...a sign saying that the highway was closed because of snow.
example.tran: 声明公路因大雪而关闭的告示牌

example.ex: ...a cardboard sign, which stated 'No to Poll Tax'...
example.tran: 写有“反对人头税”的硬纸板抗议牌

entry.def: If there is a sign of something, there is something which shows that it exists or is happening.

example.ex: They are prepared to hand back a hundred prisoners of war a day as a sign of good will...
example.tran: 他们准备每日遣返100名战俘以示友好。

example.ex: His face and movements rarely betrayed a sign of nerves...
example.tran: 他的表情和行为几乎没有流露出紧张的迹象。

entry.tran: 在…上签名;在…上签字;签署
entry.def: When you sign a document, you write your name on it, usually at the end or in a special space. You do this to indicate that you have written the document, that you agree with what is written, or that you were present as a witness.

example.ex: World leaders are expected to sign a treaty pledging to increase environmental protection...
example.tran: 世界各国首脑预计会签署一份承诺加强环境保护的协定。

example.ex: Before an operation the patient will be asked to sign a consent form.
example.tran: 手术前患者将被要求在同意书上签字。

entry.def: If an organization signs someone or if someone signs for an organization, they sign a contract agreeing to work for that organization for a specified period of time.

example.ex: The Minnesota Vikings signed Herschel Walker from the Dallas Cowboys...
example.tran: 明尼苏达维京人队签下了来自达拉斯牛仔队的赫舍尔·沃克。

example.ex: The band then signed to Slash Records.
example.tran: 随后乐队和伤痕唱片公司签约。

entry.def: In astrology, a sign or a sign of the zodiac is one of the twelve areas into which the heavens are divided.

example.ex: The New Moon takes place in your opposite sign of Libra on the 15th.
example.tran: 15 日新月会移至你对面的天秤宫。

entry.def: If you say that there is no sign of someone, you mean that they have not yet arrived, although you are expecting them to come.

example.ex: The London train was on time, but there was no sign of my Finnish friend.
example.tran: 伦敦的火车准点到达，却不见我那芬兰朋友的踪影。

entry.tran: 已签字盖章的;已成定局的
entry.def: If you say that an agreement is signed and sealed, or signed, sealed and delivered, you mean that it is absolutely definite because everyone involved has signed all the legal documents.

example.ex: The Chancellor had been hoping to have an agreement signed and sealed by the end of this week...
example.tran: 财政大臣一直期望这周末前能敲定一份协议。

example.ex: A government spokesman said the bill must be signed, sealed and delivered by tomorrow.
example.tran: 一名政府发言人称议案明天必须定下来。

means.word_mean: 1. a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened);
2. a public display of a (usually written) message;

sentences.sentence: "he posted signs in all the shop windows"

means.word_mean: 3. any communication that encodes a message;
4. structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted;
5. (astrology) one of 12 equal areas into which the zodiac is divided
6. (medicine) any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease;
7. having an indicated pole (as the distinction between positive and negative electric charges);

sentences.sentence: "he got the polarity of the battery reversed"

means.word_mean: 8. an event that is experienced as indicating important things to come;
9. a gesture that is part of a sign language
10. a fundamental linguistic unit linking a signifier to that which is signified;

sentences.sentence: "The bond between the signifier and the signified is arbitrary"--de Saussure

means.word_mean: 11. a character indicating a relation between quantities;
1. mark with one's signature; write one's name (on);

sentences.sentence: "She signed the letter and sent it off"

means.word_mean: 2. approve and express assent, responsibility, or obligation;
3. be engaged by a written agreement;

sentences.sentence: "He signed to play the casino on Dec. 18"
"The soprano signed to sing the new opera"

means.word_mean: 4. engage by written agreement;

sentences.sentence: "They signed two new pitchers for the next season"

means.word_mean: 5. communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs;

sentences.sentence: "He signed his disapproval with a dismissive hand gesture"
"The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu"

means.word_mean: 6. place signs, as along a road;
7. communicate in sign language;

sentences.sentence: "I don't know how to sign, so I could not communicate with my deaf cousin"

means.word_mean: 8. make the sign of the cross over someone in order to call on God for protection; consecrate
1. used of the language of the deaf

auth_sentence.content: It was impossible for us to sign another one.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was impossible for us to sign another one.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was impossible for us to sign another one.

auth_sentence.content: Blossom is a sure sign that spring has arrived.
auth_sentence.res_content: Blossom is a sure sign that spring has arrived.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Blossom is a sure sign that spring has arrived.

auth_sentence.content: Of course, not everyone can read the sign.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, not everyone can read the sign.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, not everyone can read the sign.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =mark,表示"记号,信号,标志"; 2. 签署

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意义的;重大的,重要的
stems_affixes.word_buile: significance[[n.意义,含义;重要性,重要的]]→adj.有意义的;重大的,重要的
in内部+sign记号,信号,标志+ia状态→内部标志

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分配,指派;[指定的]作业,[分派的]任务
stems_affixes.word_buile: assign派给,分配+ment表名词→n.分配,指派;[指定的]作业,[分派的]任务
consign[v.托运,托人看管]+ment表名词→n.托运,寄售
de加强+sign记号→做好记号→设计
designate[v.指明,指出;任命,指派]+ion表名词→designation指定

stems_affixes.value_cn: 旗, 军舰旗, 军旗, 徽章,舰旗[船上表示所属国家的旗帜]
stems_affixes.word_buile: en内部+sign记号,信号,标志→内部标志
resign[v.辞去,辞职,使听从[于],使顺从]+ation表名词→n.放弃,辞职,反抗
sign记号,信号,标志→n.符号；手势；征兆，迹象 v. 签名；作手势
sign记号,信号,标志+al→n.信号,暗号 v.发信号,用信号通知
sign记号,信号,标志+ature表名词→记号的东西→签名
sign记号,信号,标志+et做记号→图章

stems_affixes.value_cn: 意义,含义;重要性,重要的
stems_affixes.word_buile: signifi=signify[v.表示,意味;要紧,有重要性]+cance→n.意义,含义;重要性,重要的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 派给,分配;选定,指定[时间,地点等]
stems_affixes.word_buile: as加强+sign签署→指定
de加强+sign记号→做好记号→设计
de加强+sign记号+ate表动词→指定记号→指定,指明
con共同+sign记号,信号,标志→共同做记号→把……委托给别人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 辞去,辞职,使听从[于],使顺从
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+sign签署→v.辞去,辞职,使听从[于],使顺从
sign记号,信号,标志→n.符号；手势；征兆，迹象 v. 签名；作手势
sign记号,信号,标志+al→n.信号,暗号 v.发信号,用信号通知

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使著名, 使显著, 使显眼, 向……发信号
stems_affixes.word_buile: signal信号+ize表动词→发信号
sign记号,信号,标志+et做记号→图章

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表示,意味;要紧,有重要性
stems_affixes.word_buile: sign记号,信号,标志+ify……化→用信号表示→象征

Sentence.sentence: Didn't you see the private sign over there?
The woman was putting up a sign on the wall
The editor is amazed at how quickly Smith gets his stories—only minutes after they happen—but soon he's presented with a contract to sign.
And that box there to confirm you have known driving convictions, thank you, and then sign there.

But there is also time for brief diversions onto bizarre ground, such as a discussion of the skyscraper index (which holds that a boom in skyscraper construction is a foolproof sign of an imminent recession)
Skyscrapers are a sure sign of a city's prosperity.

means.word_mean: 标记, 符号

sentences.en: I'll be waiting for you at the entrance of the pub which has a sign painted with a red lobster.
sentences.cn: 我将在画着红龙虾招牌的酒吧门口等你。

means.word_mean: 手势, 姿势, 信号

sentences.en: I saw him making signs at us.
sentences.cn: 我看见他向我们做着手势。

sentences.en: She put her finger to her lips as a sign to be quiet.
sentences.cn: 她将手指放在唇上表示应安静。

sentences.en: They waved the white flag as a sign that they wish to surrender.
sentences.cn: 他们挥动白旗表示愿意投降。

means.word_mean: 征兆, 迹象

sentences.en: All the signs at the moment point to an early resumption of the fighting between the two countries.
sentences.cn: 眼下的一切迹象都表明, 这两个国家将很快重新开战。

sentences.en: The roof of the new tunnel hasn't been properly supported; it shows signs of falling in.
sentences.cn: 新隧道的顶部支撑得不好, 已显出坍塌的迹象。

sentences.en: There is every sign to show that the enemy will retreat.
sentences.cn: 种种迹象表明敌人要退却。

means.word_mean: 签名, 签字

sentences.en: He wants all of us to sign.
When we arrive at the office each morning we have to sign on the dotted line.
sentences.cn: 我们每天早上到达办公室的时候, 得在签到簿上签到。

means.word_mean: 发信号, 做手势

sentences.cn: 老师做了手势表示同意。

sentences.en: Glancing to door, he signed that he was ready to leave.
sentences.cn: 他看着门口打手势表示他随时可以离开。

sentences.en: He signed her to lower her voice.
sentences.cn: 他摆摆手要她把声音放低点。

sentences.en: He signed me to be quiet.
While we were crossing the street, the policeman signed for us to stop.
sentences.cn: 我们正横穿马路时, 警察做手势叫我们停住。

sentences.en: He signed to the waiter to bring the bill.
sentences.cn: 他向服务生示意拿账单过来。

sentences.en: He signed to his student where to go.
sentences.cn: 他示意他的学生该去何处。

sentences.en: The police signed to the driver that it was time to go.

means.word_mean: [sign oneself] 在署名中把(自己)称作

sentences.cn: 她在署名中把自己称作“和平使者”。

means.word_mean: 预示；表示

sentences.en: It signs that he will lose his temper.

jushi.english: I'll be waiting for you at the entrance of the pub which has a sign painted with a red lobster.
jushi.chinese: 我将在画着红龙虾招牌的酒吧门口等你。

jushi.english: The sign means that cars cannot enter.
jushi.chinese: 这种标志表示汽车不能入内。

jushi.english: Those signs pointed the route to be followed by visitors.
jushi.chinese: 那些标志为参观者指明了路线。
